Female Business Development Executive Job at Kaplo Africa




        
    

        
        Kaplo Africa - Our client is a top pharmaceutical firm committed to promotive health care products and services for vulnerable populations — enhancing early detection, diagnosis, and prevention of diseases

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Business Development Executive
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a smart, skilled, and results-driven Female Business Development Executive to join their dynamic team in Abuja.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Drive sales and market expansion for the company’s health care products and services.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, hospitals, and distributors.
	Execute marketing strategies that promote preventive health awareness.
	Achieve and exceed monthly sales targets with measurable impact.


Requirements


	Proven experience in business development, sales, or marketing (pharma/health sector preferred).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Goal-oriented, proactive, and passionate about improving community health outcomes.


Offer Details


	N150,000 Net Monthly Salary
	Hybrid Role (Work from office twice weekly after 1-week training)
	15% Net Profit Commission on Sales
	Transport Allowance for Marketing
	Airtime Allowance for Calls.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: kaploafrica@gmail.com using “Female Sales Executive- Pharmaceutical, Abuja” as the subject of the email.

Note: If you’re a driven professional ready to make impact in the health sector while building a rewarding career, apply now!.

Operations Manager Job at Smart Partners Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Smart Partners Consulting Limited(SPCL) is an indigenous consulting firm poised on the business model of collaboration to provide professional services of Human Resources and Business Strategy to different companies in various sectors of Nigeria’s economy. It was incorporated in July 2013. Our idea of collaboration and partnership involves the synergy of tested experts in the market place to research, identify and proffer solutions to the ever dynamic needs of our Clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager
Job Location: Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting: Reports to the Board of Directors

Position
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The candidate specializes in art or appreciates it. Ability to develop new accounts and increasing the business of existing accounts.
	Identifies prospects’ advertising, marketing, and business issues and matches these with the Society’s capabilities and ideas.
	Develops strategies and tactics for pursuing selected prospects, organizes and participates in art presentations and events.
	The objective isto increase the appreciation of art for its stakeholders i.e., collectors, artistes, insurance companies etc. through visibility and brand recognition to strengthen and expand the Society’s client base.
	The position holder must observe the confidentiality of client and Society matters.


Duties & Responsibilities
The Operations Manager will have primary responsibility and authority to lead and administer these important functions of the Firm:


	Develop marketing research and strategies
	Budgeting
	Media and Public Relations
	Promotion and branding
	Sponsorships
	Business Development.


Requirements
Minimum Qualification Requirements Education:


	Master’s Degree in Business (Specialization in Marketing)
	Second Class Upper Degree in a first degree
	Five years in a Business Development/ (Creative) Marketing Manager role within a professional services environment (Art/ Creative experience preferred)
	Additional professional certification in Management/ (Digital) Marketing/ Graphics Design is an added advantage


Skills:


	Oversee daily operations of the organization and the work of executives (Marketing, Sales, Finance, etc.)
	Ensure participation in the organization’s expansion projects/ activities, i.e., investments, acquisitions, corporate alliances, and ensuring successful executions.
	Facilitate decision-making processes, program development, and strategic plans to sustain the company
	Represent the Society in external functions: partnership meetings, conferences, and the media
	Ensure quality monitoring process and evaluation of the Society’s projects.
	Ensure effective management and implementation of the Society’s budget
	Drive sponsorship and partnership for the Society.
	Maintain current client relationships and identify areas for potential clients through contact to establish a business relationship and meet with them.
	Research the latest in the business industry, explore new development areas, and create new opportunities to expand the organization.
	Setting goals and developing plans for the organization and revenue growth
	Researching, planning, and implementing new target market/ sponsorship initiatives
	Setting comprehensive goals for the performance and growth of the team and developing strategies to meet those goals
	Training business development staff
	Establishing policies that promote company culture and vision
	Establish policies that promote company culture and vision
	Marketing management and strategic planning experience
	Successful development and administration of a marketing program
	Ability to write effectively for public relations level content for internal and external audiences and to prepare written materials to support and follow-up marketing opportunities for the Firm.
	“Firm first” attitude and mindset
	Perform in-depth research to identify new market opportunities and establish market trends
	Organize strategy sessions to identify customer pain points and prospect sales opportunities
	Innovative with concepts to promote the brand, plus services & products.


Compensation
Commensurate with experience and credentials. Full benefits package

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: talent@smartpartnersng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
